CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: Консултантски услуги, свързани с експериментални разработки
Υπηρεσίες παροχής συμβουλών σε θέματα ανάπτυξης
Servizi di consulenza nel campo dello sviluppo
Serviços de consultoria em matéria de desenvolvimento

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: A feasibility study for an LNG filling station infrastructure and test of recommendations.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Working out a strategic decision paper on the establishment of an LNG infrastructure in the Baltic Sea, the North Sea and the English Channel based on a feasibility study of central enablers with the aim of making LNG a competitive fuel for shipping in the mentioned sea areas. The decision paper must be relevant for central stakeholders as shipowners, ports, LNG providers, member states and other states and the EU, etc. Simultaneously the recommendations from the strategic decision paper must be validated through tests, including a port point of view.

The starting point is an LNG supply chain seen from reception of LNG and/or liquefaction of natural gas from the gas grid to LNG, via storage and distribution of LNG to the use of LNG in ships for propulsion.
The recommendations shall encompass a physical infrastructure of LNG filling stations as well as a supporting structure of public regulations, classification rules, industry standards, etc.

Additional information pertaining to the subject matter is available at http://www.dma.dk/news/Sider/Liquefiednaturalgasastheinexpensive,environmentallyfriendly,future,alternativeship%E2 %80 %99sfuel.aspx and http://www.dma.dk/SiteCollectionDocuments/Tema/LNG-tender/LNG-Tender.doc.

DEPOSITS_GUARANTEES_REQUIRED.P: If advance payment is required this will have to be against an irrevocable bank guarantee from a well established bank or guarantor.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITIONS.P: Terms of financing and payment will be stated in the tender documents.

LEGAL_FORM.P: There are no specific requirements regarding legal form. If the contract is awarded to a group of candidates (for instance a consortium) the participants are required to undertake joint and several liability and to authorize one candidate to represent the group and who will be point of contact towards the contracting authority.

EXISTENCE_OTHER_PARTICULAR_CONDITIONS.P: The awarded contract will contain a clause according to which the consultant must use assistance from some partners in the project according to predetermined hourly pays and competences, including for test of recommendations. The concerned partners are foreseen to be as follows:

Port of Hirtshals (DK), Port of Zeebrugge (BE), Szczecin and Swinoujscie Seaports Authority (PL), Gasum (FI), Gasunie (NL), Energinet.dk (DK), Gasnor (NO), Germanischer Lloyd (DE), MAN Diesel and Turbo (DK), and Lauritzen Kosan A/S (DK).

The partners in the project "A feasibility study for an LNG filling station infrastructure and test of recommendations" will not be able to participate in the tender as candidates or as subcontractors to candidates.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: 1) A solemn declaration stating whether the candidate has fulfilled its obligations relating to the payment of social security contributions in accordance with the legal provisions in the country in which the candidate is established and in Denmark.

2) A solemn declaration stating whether the candidate has fulfilled its obligations relating to the payment of direct and indirect taxes in accordance with the legal provisions in the country in which the candidate is established and in Denmark.

It is important that the solemn declaration belongs to the exact legal entity (for instance the company) that is submitting the request. Foreign candidates submitting an equal report from their country should also submit a solemn declaration regarding obligations in Denmark. If a request to participate is submitted by a group of candidates, each candidate must submit the above-mentioned declarations.
The information can be provided by completing the document available at: http://www.dma.dk/SiteCollectionDocuments/Tema/LNG-tender/LNG-Tender.doc.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: 1) Declaration concerning the applicant's equity for the latest available accounting year.
2) Declaration concerning the applicant's turnover for the latest available accounting year.
The information can be provided by completing the document available at: http://www.dma.dk/SiteCollectionDocuments/Tema/LNG-tender/LNG-Tender.doc.

EAF_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: The information can be provided by completing the document available at: http://www.dma.dk/SiteCollectionDocuments/Tema/LNG-tender/LNG-Tender.doc.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: References from similar projects the last 3 years.
CV information should not be submitted as such information will be included in the final evaluation process only.
The information can be provided by completing the document available at: http://www.dma.dk/SiteCollectionDocuments/Tema/LNG-tender/LNG-Tender.doc.

T_CAPACITY_MIN_LEVEL.P: 1) Tasks on LNG supply chains seen from reception of LNG and/or liquefaction of natural gas from the gas grid to LNG, via storage and distribution of LNG to the use of LNG in ships for propulsion (abbreviated to LNG supply chains in point 2) - 5) below.
2) Design of an LNG supply chain and its components.
3) Public regulations, classification rules for ships, industry standards, safety management systems, etc. on the basis of an LNG supply chain and its components.
4) Risk assessment, audits and surveying, etc. on the basis of an LNG supply chain and its components.
5) Economic business models on the basis on an LNG supply chain and its components.
6) LNG as environmental and energy-efficient fuel compared with relevant oil based fuels.
8) EU regulation and national regulation from either of the states bordering the Baltic Sea, the North Sea or the English Channel regarding third party access.
9) Experience on international projects with different stakeholders, involved directly as well as indirectly.
10) Experience with involvement of stakeholders with the aim of creating commitment.
The information can be provided by completing the document available at: http://www.dma.dk/SiteCollectionDocuments/Tema/LNG-tender/LNG-Tender.doc.

OPE_OBJECTIVE_CRITERIA.P: Best and most relevant competences from similar projects.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: 1) There is no further documentation to be obtained by the candidate prior to submitting a request for participation (prequalification). The tender documents will be forwarded to the candidates selected to participate in the tender.

2) Candidates must provide the information stated in section III.2 regarding legal, economic, financial and technical information. Groups of candidates must provide the information regarding each candidate in the group. A candidate may thus be excluded from participation if the requested information is not submitted.

3) If a candidate wishes to rely on the capacities of other entities (for instance a parent company or a subcontractor), the candidate relying on capacities or references of other legal entities must in the request for prequalification prove to the contracting authority that the candidate will have at its disposal the resources necessary for the execution of the contract, for instance by enclosing documentation that the candidate can rely on the capacities of the other legal entity.
4) The date stated in section IV.3 is an estimated date.

5) The contracting authority would like the request for prequalification to be submitted in four printed copies and electronically in PDF or similar formats for distribution to the project partners marked "request for prequalification - A feasibility study for an LNG filling station infrastructure and test of recommendations. - Not to be opened". Request for prequalification must be submitted to the contact person stated in I.1. Request for prequalification cannot be forwarded by e-mail. In case of any possible discrepancies between the electronic version and printed version, the printed version will take precedence over the electronic version.
6) Each candidate may only submit one request for prequalification.

CONTACT_DATA_WITHOUT_RESPONSIBLE_NAME.ORGANISATION: The Danish Complaints Board (Klagenævnet for Udbud)
CONTACT_DATA_WITHOUT_RESPONSIBLE_NAME.ADDRESS: The Danish Commerce and Companies Agency (Erhvervs- og Selskabsstyrelsen), Kampmannsgade 1

LODGING_OF_APPEALS_PRECISION.P: Appeals regarding prequalification must be submitted within 30 calendar days calculated from the day after the contracting authority informed the participants. Appeals regarding the tender must be submitted no later than six months after the contracting authority has published a contract award notice in Tenders Electronic Daily (TED). The deadline is calculated from the date of publication. At the same time as lodging the appeal to the Danish Complaints Board (Klagenævnet for Udbud) the complainant is obliged to inform the contracting authority in writing that the appeal has been lodged and whether the appeal has been submitted during the standstill period. If the complaint has not been lodged in the standstill period the complainant is obliged to indicate if the complaint is requested to have delaying effect.
